query: Your task is to: put two soapbar in garbagecan.

trajectory.observation: You arrive at cabinet 1. The cabinet 1 is closed.
You open the cabinet 1. The cabinet 1 is open. In it, you see nothing.
You arrive at sinkbasin 1. On the sinkbasin 1, you see a soapbar 3, and a soapbar 2.

memory_items.title: Verify Object Presence Before Moving
memory_items.description: Avoid moving to a location without confirming the presence of required objects
memory_items.content: In the trajectory, the agent moved to cabinet 1 without verifying if the required soapbars were present, leading to a wasted step. Before moving to a location, the agent should check if the required objects are available at the current location or have information that confirms their presence at the target location.

memory_items.title: Check Container Status Before Opening
memory_items.description: Avoid opening containers that are known to be empty
memory_items.content: The agent opened cabinet 1 without prior knowledge of its contents, which turned out to be empty. This step could have been avoided by checking the status of the container or having a prior step to gather information about the contents of the cabinet. This prevents unnecessary actions and saves time.

memory_items.title: Plan Multiple Object Retrievals Efficiently
memory_items.description: Avoid multiple trips by planning to retrieve all required objects in one go
memory_items.content: The task required picking up two soapbars, but the agent only checked one location (sinkbasin 1) after finding it empty at cabinet 1. A more efficient approach would be to plan a route that checks all potential locations for the required objects before starting the retrieval process, ensuring that all objects are collected in the fewest steps possible.

query: Your task is to: cool some lettuce and put it in countertop.

trajectory.observation: You arrive at fridge 1. The fridge 1 is closed.
You open the fridge 1. The fridge 1 is open. In it, you see a cup 1, a mug 2, a plate 1, a pot 1, a potato 1, a tomato 2, and a tomato 1.
You arrive at countertop 1. On the countertop 1, you see a apple 1, a creditcard 1, a fork 1, a glassbottle 1, a lettuce 1, a saltshaker 2, and a spatula 1.

memory_items.title: Verify Item Availability Before Moving
memory_items.description: Always check if the required item is available before moving to the next location.
memory_items.content: In the trajectory, the agent moved to the fridge expecting to find lettuce, but the lettuce was actually on the countertop. To prevent this, the agent should first verify the presence of the required item in the current or expected location before proceeding.

memory_items.title: Plan Actions Based on Current Observations
memory_items.description: Base actions on the most recent observations to avoid outdated information.
memory_items.content: The agent opened the fridge without checking if the lettuce was inside, leading to a wasted step. Instead, the agent should have observed the contents of the fridge before deciding to open it, or checked the countertop first since it was mentioned in the task goal.

memory_items.title: Follow Task Requirements Sequentially
memory_items.description: Ensure all steps of the task are followed in the correct order to avoid missing critical actions.
memory_items.content: The task required cooling the lettuce and then placing it on the countertop, but the agent did not cool the lettuce after finding it. To prevent this, the agent should systematically follow the task requirements, ensuring each step is completed before moving to the next, such as cooling the lettuce before attempting to place it.

query: Your task is to: put two vase in desk.

trajectory.observation: You arrive at shelf 1. On the shelf 1, you see a remotecontrol 1, a vase 2, and a vase 1.
You pick up the vase 1 from the shelf 1.
You arrive at desk 1. On the desk 1, you see a box 2.

memory_items.title: Verify Object Availability Before Moving
memory_items.description: Always check if the required objects are available before moving to the next location.
memory_items.content: In the trajectory, the agent moved to the desk 1 with only one vase, without verifying if the second vase was available on the shelf 1. This led to a failure as the task required placing two vases on the desk. To prevent this, the agent should ensure that both vases are picked up before moving to the desk.

memory_items.title: Plan for Multiple Objects
memory_items.description: Plan the sequence of actions to handle multiple objects efficiently.
memory_items.content: The agent picked up only one vase and moved to the desk, which was inefficient and led to the task failure. A better approach would be to pick up both vases from the shelf 1 before moving to the desk 1, ensuring that the task can be completed in fewer steps and without the need to return to the shelf.

memory_items.title: Confirm Task Requirements
memory_items.description: Ensure all task requirements are met before concluding the task.
memory_items.content: The agent failed to complete the task because it did not verify that both vases were placed on the desk. Before concluding the task, the agent should have confirmed that all required objects (in this case, two vases) were placed in the correct location. This would help in identifying any missing steps and ensuring the task is completed successfully.
